instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message:
Board runs well but will not recognize / charge battery.

All zeros in system profiler, yet when charger is removed it manages to successfully go to sleep from battery power.

I feel I'm close but obviously missing key things. Please see my marked up image to see all that has been tested. Both new and original battery with same results.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message:
did you check <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA</SIGNAL> line?  also don't take measurements in auto mode.  use Either K or diode mode.  

Its going to be the battery indicator, isl, or smc.  or both.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message: Bad battery/SMC/<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Disconnect battery and check voltage on both SMBUS data lines to the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message:
pin 5 of J7050 <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> .4v
pin 6 of J7050 <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> 3.4v / .2v
with no batt connected

tested with 3 batteries
SMC very clean and LD not near there.
has been through UC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message: Dead SMC and/or <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> for sure. SMC is most likely, but ISL is easiest, you pick.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message: You can use a donor SMC from a 3787, I believe one from a 3662 will work also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi. I have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> model with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board that shows the same problem. Initialy the machine stopped powering on after the owner took it apart to fix the hinges. Then he took it to a technician who managed to make it power on but only with the charger pluged in. After that I got it. The battery is marked with an X and if I take off the charger the machine goes to sleep.
PP3v42 is present
SMBUS lines look ok
I get 11.5 V on <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> witch is pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> and I guess that does not alow it to open.
ISL and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> chip have been changed, but I still get 11.5v on <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>.
I am not verry experienced with this but I am trying pretty hard so some help would much apreciated.
Than you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Does not see / reconize / charge battery - liquid damage
threads.message: Don't hijack threads, start a new one.
